column3: MISSINGNESS: Is this required to be present if this form is submitted?
column4: CONFORMITY: What values/ranges/characters, etc. are allowed for this field?
column5: PLAUSIBILITY: Is this concept or a concept related to it assessed again at any point within any other UDSv4 IVP forms (including witihin the same form)?
column20: PLAUSIBILITY: Was this concept assessed in any previous versions of the UDS?
column23: PLAUSIBILITY: Is this concept assessing something that can plausibly change from one visit to another (e.g., diabetes at visit 1 and no diabetes at visit 2; severe impairment at visit 1 and no impairment at visit 2, etc.)?
column24: How many errors/alerts should there be for this variable?
column25: Major variable changes for RDD-UDS update?
column27: Short version of question for english test output (for data core)

column1: 1. What is the co-participant’s relationship to the participant?
column28: Same INRELTO var in all 3 versions

column1: 2. How long has the co-participant known the participant?
3. Does the co-participant live with the participant?
column28: Check against responses in A1 Q6 (participant's living situation) to see if they make sense against what is reported here). Same INLIVWTH var in all 3 versions compared to v3-4 LIVSITUA (and v1-2 LIVSIT, LIVSITX for follow-up packets)

column1: 4. What is the primary mode of contact with the participant?
column28: Going to assume the 8=Other changes to 6

column1: 4a. Primary mode of contact with the participant - Other (specify)
column27: Q4a. INCNTMDX (specify primary contact mode w/participant)
column28: Only needs to be filled in if INCNTMOD = (Other)

column1: 4a1. What is the approximate frequency of contact?
column28: Going to assume the 8=Less than once a month changes to 6

column1: 4a2. What is the average amount of time spent in contact with the participant during each encounter?
5. Is there a question about the co-participant’s reliability?
column28: Same INRELY var in all 3 versions

column1: 6. Do you feel like the participant's memory is becoming worse?
column28: Participant gives their subjective opinion of their memory in A1 and B9, but co-participant doesn't need to agree with participant

column1: 7. About how often does the participant have trouble remembering things?
column28: Participant gives their subjective opinion of their memory in A1 and B9, but co-participant doesn't need to agree with participant

column1: 8. Compared to 10 years ago, would you say that the participant's memory is much worse, a little worse, the same, a little better, or much better?
column27: Q10. INMEMTEN (participant's memory compared to 10 years ago?)
column28: Participant gives their subjective opinion of their memory in A1 and B9, but co-participant doesn't need to agree with participant
